channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Will Canada Abandon Its EV Mandate?
item.description: Liberal politicians like Mark Carney are slowly waking up to voters’ frustration with the expensive climate policies they imposed.

item.title: DHS slams Dems for complaining about immigration law: 'It is quite literally their job to change it'
item.description: Democrats call for Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem's impeachment following fatal ICE-involved shooting, while DHS defends enforcement actions.

item.title: Oracle struggles to attract workers to Nashville ‘world HQ’—even with a 2-million-square-foot office and Larry Ellison’s favorite restaurant
item.description: Years after cofounder Larry Ellison declared Nashville its world headquarters, Oracle has added only a handful of workers.

item.title: Children are at risk of forming romantic bonds with AI chatbots, experts warn
item.description: Congress hears alarming testimony about AI chatbots harming children's mental health, with experts warning of serious emotional risks and dangers.

item.title: Vulnerable Dems Throw Their Lot In With The ‘Abolish Immigration Law’ Crowd
item.description: Perhaps the defund ICE message is playing well in solidly blue districts, but competitive district politics is a different animal.

item.description: Your sale to AT&T was a turning point in our national history.

item.title: Customers lament Tesla’s move toward monthly fees for self-driving cars: ‘You will own nothing and be happy’

item.title: The Credit Card Interest Cap Is a Scam

item.title: Worried about AI taking your job? New Anthropic research shows it’s not that simple
item.description: Anthropic’s latest data suggests AI won’t wipe out work overnight—but it will redraw the map of who wins, who struggles, and how jobs actually change.

item.title: Americans Are Going Where No Man Has Gone Before
item.description: We’re back in the space race, and it’s awesome.
